data: ONCS AMB Post Procedure (Paracentesis/ Thoracentesis / Lumbar Puncture) (Multiphase)
Provider to select one Procedural phase of this plan
Nurse to initiate the appropriate Procedural phase of this plan
Discontinue ONCS AMB Pre Procedure (Paracentesis / Thoracentesis  / Lumbar Puncture) (Day of Treatment) PowerPlan
If vital signs are stable and asites drainage complete
Prior to paracentesis and during paracentesis PRN and after paracentesis is complete (prior to discharge)
Discontinue Abdominal Drainage Tube once _____litres of ascites has drained
Drain until ascites slows and then discontinue catheter
If no flow or significantly more flow than expected
For the following:   - Heart rate increase of 20 bpm  - SBP decrease of 10 mmHg  - Severe abdominal pain  - New Bloody drainage from the insertion site more than 100 mL/h
Consider discussing with patient when to resume anticoagulant medication(s) (if applicable)
dose range: 325 to 975 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 8 hour, drug form: tab
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, NG-tube, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 8 hour, drug form: tab
TYLENOL #3 EQUIV tab PRN range dose
dose range: 1 to 2 tab, PO, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 8 hour, drug form: tab
For large volume drainage (more than 5 L) or renal impairment:
Discontinue ONCS AMB Pre Procedure (Paracentesis / Thoracentesis  / Lumbar Puncture) (Day of Treatment) PowerPlan
If vital signs are stable and provider has reviewed the chest xray
Prior to thoracentesis and during thoracentesis PRN and after paracentesis is complete (prior to discharge)
T;N, q15min for 1 hour then as per unit policy
Significant change of blood pressure or heart rate and / or oxygen saturation is 5% below baseline and  / or severe pain and / or excessive coughing
Consider discussing with patient when to resume anticoagulant medication(s) (if applicable)
dose range: 325 to 975 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, NG-tube, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 8 hour, drug form: tab
TYLENOL #3 EQUIV tab PRN range dose
dose range: 1 to 2 tab, PO, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 8 hour, drug form: tab
Urgent, Reason: to rule out pneumothorax post thoracentesis left side, Special Instructions: PA and Lateral View  and Inspiratory/expiratory, Order for future visit
Urgent, Reason: to rule out pneumothorax post thoracentesis right side, Special Instructions: PA and Lateral View  and Inspiratory/expiratory, Order for future visit
Discontinue ONCS AMB Pre Procedure (Paracentesis / Thoracentesis  / Lumbar Puncture) (Day of Treatment) PowerPlan
30 minutes post-procedure if vital signs are stable and lumbar puncture site dry
Give Patient Information Pamphlet on discharge if applicable
In the event of post-procedural bleed of the puncture site, compress firmly with fingers for 10 minutes
Notify provider immediately if change in vital signs of +/- 20%, any bleeding at puncture site, pain not relieved by analgesia, nausea or significant changes in patient status
Consider discussing with patient when to resume anticoagulant medication(s) (if applicable)
dose range: 325 to 975 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 8 hour, drug form: tab
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, NG-tube, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 8 hour, drug form: tab
